summary: Email chain between attorney Sigrid McCawley and a U.S. Attorney's office regarding coordination of meetings and requests for contact information for potential witnesses Anthony Figueroa and an unnamed individual (likely a victim/witness) who opened a hair salon. The emails discuss FBI agents visiting McCawley's law firm office and background on the potential witnesses.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office to coordinate meetings and provide contact information for potential witnesses Anthony Figueroa and an unnamed individual.

persons.name: Tony Figueroa
persons.context: Referenced as someone who likely has helpful information about Epstein and others, but may be uncooperative and has had a rough past.

persons.name: Dore Louis
persons.context: Represented an individual (likely Sjorberg) pro bono for a deposition in the Maxwell case, and gave permission for direct contact.

connections.description: McCawley possesses contact information for Figueroa and provides background to the U.S. Attorney's office, suggesting she has prior knowledge of him as a potential source of information on Epstein.
McCawley references a prior conversation with Louis, who was the attorney for a witness (likely Sjorberg), and Louis gave permission for McCawley to contact the witness directly.

events.title: FBI meeting at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
events.description: FBI agents are scheduled to visit the law firm's office for meetings, arriving between 9:30-10:00 AM and staying into the afternoon.

locations: Beautyfool Hair Studio (hair salon in West Palm Beach, Florida)
Boies Schiller Flexner LLP (law firm office)
keyFacts: Attorney Sigrid McCawley is assisting the U.S. Attorney's office in contacting potential witnesses, including Anthony Figueroa, who is believed to have helpful information about Jeffrey Epstein and others.
McCawley notes that Figueroa may be uncooperative, does not like being dragged into things, and has had a rough past.
FBI agents were scheduled to meet at McCawley's law firm office on Friday, March 22, 2019, indicating ongoing investigative coordination.

An unnamed individual (likely a victim/witness, possibly referenced as 'Sjorberg') opened a new hair salon in West Palm Beach, and her attorney Dore Louis had represented her pro bono in a deposition related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
